scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Production AKS cluster with 10 general-purpose nodes, managed NAT gateway, static public IP, basic monitoring, Key Vault and Backup.

resources.notes: Single VNet hosting AKS node pool and NAT gateway. No direct VNet charge but required for topology.
AKS node pool with 10 nodes, each assumed with 128 GB OS disk (Premium SSD) included in VM pricing. Standard_D4s_v3 (4 vCPUs, 16 GB RAM) as balanced general-purpose SKU.
AKS managed control plane. Billed per cluster/hour according to AKS pricing tier. No SKU name exposed via ARM.
Managed NAT Gateway providing outbound connectivity for AKS nodes. 5 TB/month egress to internet as requested. Throughput_mbps is an estimate for sizing.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Static Standard Public IP associated with NAT Gateway or AKS ingress as required. User explicitly requested static public IP.
Internet egress data transfer from AKS workloads. 5 TB/month as specified by user. Billed as outbound data transfer.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Log Analytics workspace for AKS logs and metrics. Assumes ~200 GB/month ingestion and some query egress. Adjust based on actual logging level.
Standard Key Vault for AKS secrets, certificates, and keys. Operations_per_month is an estimate for secret gets/sets.
Recovery Services vault for backing up AKS-related configuration or attached disks if used. 200 GB backup storage as a baseline estimate.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: AKS cluster with 10 smaller nodes, same NAT gateway and egress, reduced monitoring and backup footprint to minimize cost.

resources.notes: Same VNet topology as baseline. No direct cost.
10x Standard_D2s_v3 (2 vCPUs, 8 GB RAM) to reduce cost. Assumes 1-year reserved instances for savings. Suitable if workloads are moderate.
resources.error: Reservation unit of measure looks hourly/monthly; treated as ambiguous

resources.notes: Same AKS control plane as baseline.
Same 5 TB/month outbound via NAT Gateway. No change for cost optimization.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Static Standard Public IP as requested.
Same 5 TB/month internet egress.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Reduced logging (e.g., only critical and warning) to ~80 GB/month ingestion to save cost.
Key Vault with fewer operations assumed to slightly reduce cost.
Smaller backup footprint (shorter retention or fewer protected items) to reduce cost.

scenarios.label: High Performance
scenarios.description: AKS cluster with 10 larger nodes for higher throughput, same NAT gateway and egress, enhanced logging capacity.

resources.notes: Same VNet topology, potentially with larger subnets to accommodate scaling.
10x Standard_D8s_v3 (8 vCPUs, 32 GB RAM) for higher performance and capacity. Larger OS disks assumed (256 GB each).
Same AKS control plane; performance comes from node size.
Same 5 TB/month outbound, but throughput_mbps estimated higher to reflect more concurrent connections.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Static Standard Public IP as requested.
Same 5 TB/month internet egress volume; higher assumed peak throughput.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Higher log volume (detailed diagnostics, container logs) estimated at 400 GB/month ingestion.
Key Vault with higher operations to support more secrets/keys and frequent rotations.
Larger backup storage to support more workloads or longer retention for high-performance scenario.
